senses.sense_definition: The act or state of including everything completely without leaving anything out.

examples.text: The report aims for the <w>encompassment</w> of all relevant community views.
Her philosophy is remarkable for its <w>encompassment</w> of diverse scientific fields.

senses.sense_definition: The act of surrounding something or the state of being surrounded.

examples.text: The high wall provided a complete <w>encompassment</w> of the ancient fortress.
Strategic <w>encompassment</w> of the city was necessary to cut off supplies.

senses.sense_definition: A hierarchical structure where a dominant element includes and subordinates its opposite within a whole.

examples.text: The professor explained the concept of <w>encompassment</w> in social hierarchies.
This model relies on the <w>encompassment</w> of minority groups by the dominant culture.
